## 👋 Welcome 





## 🔧 Software requirements {#software}


Please ensure that you have:

- a computer or laptop with a stable (and preferably fast) internet connection, and
- a modern web browser like [Google Chrome](https://www.google.com/chrome/).

In this workshop, all R code and exercises are run in the browser using Quarto live. As such, **you don't need to install R or any R packages to participate in this workshop**. But should you wish to know use the R packages used, these include:

```r
c('tidyverse', 'ggdist', 'ggbeeswarm', 'broom', 'patchwork', 'GGally', 'ggpubr',
  'emmeans', 'modelsummary', 'ggResidpanel', 'agridat', 'faraway', 'abd')
```


## 🕜 Schedule



```{r}
#| echo: false
#| message: false
library(tidyverse)
source("scripts/schedule-setup.R")
contents <- read_csv("data/contents.csv")
contents |> 
  mutate(passed = c(0, cumsum(time)[-n()]),
         .by = day) |> 
  mutate(Day = wday(as.Date(start) + day - 1, label = TRUE),
         Day = if_else(duplicated(Day), " ", Day)) |> 
  rowwise() |> 
  mutate(AEDT = timedisplay(time, passed),
         Brisbane = timedisplay(time, passed, "Brisbane"),
         Adelaide = timedisplay(time, passed, "Adelaide"),
         Perth = timedisplay(time, passed, "Perth")) |> 
  mutate(Content = switch(type,
                              "exercise" = ex_tabset(content_id),
                              "slide" = slide_title(content_id),
                              type)) |>
  select(Day, Perth, Brisbane, Adelaide, AEDT, Content) |> 
  knitr::kable(align = "cccccl")
```
